title: Taking tough stand: India refuses to sign SCO joint statement as Pak, China go soft on terror
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh took a firm stand at the SCO meeting in China. He refused to sign a joint statement due to disagreements on terrorism. Singh condemned the use of terrorism as a state policy, targeting Pakistan. He highlighted the Pahalgam attack and called for collective action against terrorism.

title: TTP kills Pak army officer who 'captured' Abhinandan; Munir attends funeral
content: A Major from Pakistan's SSG, Moiz Abbas, known for claiming the capture of IAF pilot Abhinandan Varthaman in 2019, was killed in a TTP ambush in Waziristan. The attack resulted in the deaths of over a dozen security personnel. The Pakistan army chief attended Abbas's funeral, while the TTP claimed responsibility, stating videos of the attacks would be released soon.

title: 'Nefarious agenda': India slams Pak at UNSC; says it shelled civilians, supports terror
content: India has strongly rebuked Pakistan at the UNSC, accusing them of exploiting the platform to advance a "nefarious agenda." Ambassador Harish highlighted Pakistan's human rights abuses and cross-border terrorism, citing the Pahalgam attack where 26 tourists were killed. He mentioned Operation Sindoor, India's retaliatory strikes on terrorist infrastructure.

title: Uttarakhand: 2 killed, 8 injured after bus plunges into river; rescue ops on
content: A bus carrying pilgrims for the Char Dham Yatra plunged into the Alaknanda river in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag district, resulting in two fatalities and eight serious injuries. Nine people are still missing as the bus was swept away by strong currents. Rescue operations are underway, with the Chief Minister closely monitoring the situation and assuring all possible assistance.

title: Navy staffer held for spying for Pakistan; leaked info during Op Sindoor
content: Vishal Yadav, a clerk at the Naval office in New Delhi, has been arrested for allegedly leaking classified defence information to a Pakistani handler. He shared sensitive details, including those related to Op Sindoor, in exchange for money to fund his online gaming addiction. Yadav was apprehended in Jaipur under the Official Secrets Act.

title: America‚Äôs China threat: Huawei‚Äôs new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: 'Irrefutable from EC's own data': Cong doubles down on Maha poll fraud charge
content: The Congress party has formally lodged a complaint with the Election Commission (EC), alleging irregularities in the Maharashtra assembly polls. Rahul Gandhi previously raised concerns about "vote theft," citing a significant increase in voters between the Lok Sabha and Vidhan Sabha elections. Congress demands digital voter lists and polling day video footage from Maharashtra and Haryana.

title: One Nation, One Poll: JPC to meet July 11; key legal consultations on cards
content: The Joint Parliamentary Committee on ‚ÄòOne Nation, One Poll‚Äô will convene on July 11, 2025, to consult with legal experts and former officials regarding the proposed constitutional reforms. This meeting is part of a broader examination of bills aimed at enabling simultaneous elections to the Lok Sabha and state assemblies.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Will gold rate test Rs 1 lakh mark soon?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Amidst Middle East tensions, gold prices are fluctuating. Experts suggest watching ‚Çπ95,800 as a crucial support for gold, targeting ‚Çπ98,500 and potentially ‚Çπ1,00,000. Silver faces a decline but remains positive overall.

title: Biggest risk Reliance ever took: Mukesh Ambani to board on Jio
content: Mukesh Ambani shared his leadership philosophy, emphasizing long-term vision and risk-taking, particularly with Reliance Jio's launch. He viewed Jio as a transformative project for India, even if it meant lower returns. Inspired by his father, Ambani aims to build Reliance into an enduring institution that adapts to change and serves India for generations.

title: Chess: Who is Aarit Kapil, 9-year-old from Delhi, who almost beat Magnus Carlsen
content: Nine-year-old Aarit Kapil from New Delhi achieved a remarkable draw against World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen in an online blitz game during the Early Titled Tuesday competition. Despite time constraints, the fifth standard student maintained a winning position against the five-time world champion.

title: ‚ÄòDaddy‚Äôs home‚Äô: White House leans into viral Nato moment with Trump; shares video
content: The White House embraced the "Daddy" nickname given to President Trump by Nato Secretary General Mark Rutte. The nickname emerged after Trump's comparison of Iran and Israel to fighting schoolchildren, prompting Rutte's playful remark. Trump acknowledged the nickname affectionately, while Rutte's efforts to engage Trump during the Nato summit earned him the title of "Trump Whisperer."

title: 103* off 52 balls: Next Pant? India U19 batter Harvansh thrashes England
content: Harvansh Singh Pangalia, India U-19 wicketkeeper-batter, showcased his explosive batting prowess with a whirlwind century against England U-19 in a warm-up match. Walking in at 251/7, he smashed a rapid 100 off just 52 balls, including nine sixes, propelling India to a massive total of 442/9. Inspired by Yuvraj Singh, the young talent from Gujarat aims to represent his country.

title: Amazon employees to CEO: 'Nothing more motivating on a Tuesday than...'
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy warned corporate employees about upcoming workforce reductions due to AI-driven "efficiency gains." This announcement sparked internal backlash, with employees expressing concerns about job displacement and over-reliance on AI. Jassy envisions a future dominated by AI agents, but workers question the impact on leadership and the reliability of these systems.

title: 'Sheltering terrorists': Rajnath slams Pak at SCO Summit; Khawaja Asif present
content: At the SCO Defence Ministers' meeting in  China's Qingdao, Rajnath Singh criticized Pakistan for supporting cross-border terrorism, emphasizing that such double standards should not be tolerated. He highlighted the challenges of radicalization, extremism, and terrorism in the region, advocating for united action against these threats.

title: Watch: Ukrainian reporter asks Trump about selling missiles to Kyiv; what president said
content: During a NATO Summit press conference, President Trump expressed empathy for a Ukrainian reporter whose husband is fighting on the front lines against Russia. The reporter inquired about the potential sale of Patriot missile systems to Ukraine, prompting Trump to acknowledge Ukraine's desire for the systems. He indicated the U.S. would consider making them available, referencing their effectiveness in Israel.

title: 'No actor can stick long, if not worth their salt': Abhishek Bachchan - Exclusive
content: Abhishek Bachchan opens up on his range as an actor and being excited only when there's variety in the work he's doing. He shares anecdotes of some of his movies - something that Ram Gopal Varma told him about award shows, comparisons with Hrithik Roshan, his journey and more. This is Part 1 of the interview. Stay tuned for Part 2.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens near 25,300; BSE Sensex up over 150 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday following global cues. While Nifty50 was near 25,300, BSE Sensex rose around 150 points.

title: IND vs ENG: 'If I am Gambhir...' ‚Äì Ashwin‚Äôs surprising plea to Pant goes viral
content: R Ashwin has urged coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill to advise Rishabh Pant on converting centuries into double centuries. Pant scored centuries in both innings of the first Test against England, but India lost the match. Gambhir, while acknowledging the centuries, emphasized the importance of results over individual performances, highlighting the team's failure to win.

title: 'I can‚Äôt afford to pay': Dwyane Wade‚Äôs wife Gabrielle Union on financial strain
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, discussed her financial strategies at a recent event. She highlighted the need for multiple income streams. Union emphasized managing expenses, including supporting her extended family. She also mentioned dividing expenses with her husband, Dwyane Wade. The couple recently navigated Wade's health challenges. They continue to share updates about their lives with their fans.

title: Gunmen open fire at religious celebration in Mexico; 12 killed
content: A religious celebration in Irapuato, Mexico, turned deadly when gunmen opened fire, resulting in 12 fatalities and at least 20 injuries. The attack occurred during festivities for the Nativity of St. John the Baptist, with revellers dancing in the street when the shooting began. Guanajuato state, plagued by cartel violence, has seen a surge in homicides this year.

title: Iran nuke sites 'severely damaged': US spy chief, CIA back Trump's claim
content: Top US intelligence officials strongly refuted media reports downplaying the impact of recent airstrikes on Iran's nuclear sites. Director od national inteligence Tulsi Gabbard asserted the 'complete destruction' of facilities at Natanz, Fordow, and Isfahan, estimating years for reconstruction. CIA director John Ratcliffe confirmed 'credible intelligence' indicating serious setbacks to Iran's nuclear program.

title: IND vs ENG: Why is Jaiswal dropping catches? Ex-India cricketer explains
content: Mohammed Kaif suggests that Yashasvi Jaiswal's dropped catches in the recent Test against England may be due to the straps he wears on his hands. Kaif explains that these straps restrict finger movement, preventing a secure grip on the ball.

title: '100% communist lunatic': Trump slams Zohran Mamdani after NYC primary win
content: Donald Trump criticized Zohran Mamdani, labeling him a "100% Communist Lunatic" after his apparent mayoral primary win against Andrew Cuomo. Trump's post on Truth Social also targeted Chuck Schumer with false claims. Republicans are attempting to portray Mamdani as representative of the Democratic party, while some conservatives are attacking his faith.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs message melts hearts, Swifties emotional
content: Travis Kelce's Tight End University in Nashville became an unforgettable event when Taylor Swift made a surprise appearance. She joined country stars on stage at Brooklyn Bowl, delivering an impromptu performance of "Shake It Off" that electrified the crowd. Kelce proudly supported Swift, showcasing the couple's mutual admiration and solidifying their status as a prominent power couple.

title: Smoke and sparks midair: American flight makes emergency landing - Watch video
content: An American Airlines flight had to return to Las Vegas. This happened after smoke and sparks came from an engine. The flight, numbered 1665, was going to Charlotte. The plane landed safely with 153 passengers and six crew. No one was hurt. The aircraft is now under maintenance. The FAA is investigating the incident.

title: Cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh leave 2 dead, up to 20 missing
content: Torrential rain in Himachal Pradesh triggered cloudbursts and flash floods, resulting in at least two confirmed deaths near Dharamshala, with fears of 15-20 workers missing from a hydroelectric project site. Kullu district was severely affected, witnessing damaged homes and missing persons, while infrastructure and roads suffered extensive damage across multiple regions due to the deluge.

title: US-Iran conflict: Trump may ease oil sanctions on Tehran; says 'they're going to need money'
content: US President Donald Trump hinted at potentially easing Iran oil sanctions to aid the nation's reconstruction, even while maintaining a "maximum pressure" strategy. Trump suggested China could resume Iranian oil purchases following a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Iran. However, the White House clarified that existing US sanctions remain in effect.

title: NBA trade rumors: Warriors eye Mark Williams; $18m rookie may join Curry-Butler
content: Golden State Warriors are seeking a dominant center. The team considers trading for Charlotte's Mark Williams. Williams has potential but is injury-prone. A trade would involve Moses Moody and a draft pick. Warriors need to decide if Williams is worth the risk. Alternative options include trading for Clint Capela or Jarrett Allen.

title: 'Witch-hunt': Trump demands end to Netanyahu's corruption trial
content: Donald Trump has called for the cancellation of Benjamin Netanyahu's corruption trial, praising the former Israeli Prime Minister's wartime leadership against Iran. Trump, in a Truth Social post, condemned Israel's "witch-hunt" against Netanyahu, citing their collaboration in eliminating a significant nuclear threat. Netanyahu faces charges of accepting luxury goods and attempting to manipulate media coverage, allegations he denies.

title: India's time in space: Axiom-4 lifts off; how Dragon will put Shubhanshu Shukla inside ISS
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla made history as the second Indian to cross the Karman line, following Rakesh Sharma. Aboard the Axiom-4 mission's 'Dragon' capsule named 'Grace', Shukla radioed a message of pride to India, marking the beginning of India's human space flight program.

title: 'Rs 540cr drug money laundering': Akali Dal leader Majithia arrested after raid at Amritsar house
content: Bikram Singh Majithia, a senior SAD leader and former minister, was arrested by the Vigilance Bureau in Amritsar on Wednesday following the registration of a disproportionate assets case against him. The arrest followed investigations into a drug case, with allegations of laundering over Rs 540 crore of drug money.

title: ¬£100M F-35 fighter jet stranded in Kerala: Thiruvananthapuram Airport to charge parking fee
content: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport will levy parking fees on a grounded British Royal Navy F-35 fighter jet, stranded for nearly 10 days due to a hydraulic issue. While the fee calculation is pending, engineers from the UK and US are expected to arrive for repairs. The incident marks the first time this advanced fighter jet has been stranded abroad.

title: ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô Box Office collection day 6: Aamir Khan‚Äôs film crosses Rs 80cr mark
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par', directed by RS Prasanna, has earned over Rs 80 crore in India during its first week. The sports dramedy, considered a spiritual sequel to 'Taare Zameen Par', opened strongly with Rs 10.7 crore on Friday, peaking at Rs 27.25 crore on Sunday. The film also had a special screening at Rashtrapati Bhavan, attended by President Droupadi Murmu.

title: US sate secy Marco Rubio says Iran 'much further away from nukes' after strikes
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio stated that Iran's nuclear weapons program is significantly set back following recent US airstrikes, contradicting reports suggesting minimal impact. While President Trump hinted at regime change, Rubio clarified the US aims to prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons, viewing regime change as a potential consequence of Iran's current trajectory.

title: Trump claims Israeli agents inspected Iran site, saw 'total obliteration'
content: Following US airstrikes on Iran's Fordo nuclear site, President Trump claimed Israel might have inspected the damage, asserting "total obliteration." Despite a leaked report suggesting minimal setbacks to Iran's nuclear program, Trump insisted the strikes caused decades of delay. He warned of further action if uranium enrichment resumes, drawing a controversial comparison to the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

title: Hockey Canada sexual assault trial: Scandal threatening Canadian sports forever
content: A high-profile sexual assault trial involving five former Team Canada junior hockey players has gripped the nation. Graphic testimony and legal twists marked the intense weeks. The complainant's account of the 2018 incident was met with defense challenges. Carter Hart testified, claiming consensual acts. Justice Maria Carroccia will now rule alone after jury dismissal.

title: Indian in space: A 41-year wait that won‚Äôt repeat
content: After a 41-year gap, India celebrates Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla as its second astronaut, following Rakesh Sharma's 1984 mission. Shukla's flight signifies India's growing ambition in space exploration, closely tied to the Gaganyaan program. ISRO is developing indigenous technologies for crew safety and astronaut training, aiming for self-reliance in future missions.

title: Taylor Swift crashes Kane Brown‚Äôs big moment with bold surprise at TEU concert
content: Kane Brown headlined the Tight End University concert in Nashville, thinking he was the main attraction. However, the crowd erupted when Taylor Swift unexpectedly joined him on stage, creating a viral moment. The surprise appearance, confirmed by the NFL and TEU, delighted fans and players alike, overshadowing Brown's performance and becoming the event's highlight.

title: Inside a wild weekend with Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford
content: canelo alvarez and Terence Crawford face in a mega-fight on sept. 13 in Las Vegas . he's on the second leg of a three-leg tour to promote his upcoming fight . the pair are both confident about their upcoming clash .

content: the 2025 rookie class takes center stage in this week's fantasy women's basketball rankings update . the rankings also have a new no. 1 player as a'ja Wilson returned from injury with a bang . last week, top player Caitlin Clark has struggled over the past three games .

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, live reports
content: noggets president Josh Kroenke explains a scenario in which the team could end up trading Nikola Jokic under the second apron . the new york Knicks are still looking for a head coach, and the Boston Celtics are dramatically reshaping their roster .

title: Experts cite overuse in spate of Achilles injuries in NBA
content: Tyrese Haliburton's Achilles tendon injury has become all-too-familiar headlines in professional sports . this NBA season saw more than its usual share in the playoffs alone . two other high-profile athletes tore their Achilles earlier in the season . he has ruled out for the remainder of thursday .

content: Xavier Scruggs names the players he believes could be up for grabs at the trade deadline . some of the players on the list are unlikely to be dealt but at least are being discussed in potential deals . players are ranked by value for their new team, not likelihood of being dealt .

title: Axiom-4 astronaut crew: Spacewalker, fighter pilot, skyjumper, & radiation specialist
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the ‚ÄòJewel Thieves‚Äô scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: There‚Äôs always a story, one just has to find it. title: Divisional: Sizable movement at heavyweight, light heavyweight
content: aspinall was no. 1 in the ESPN heavyweight rankings, so nothing changes for him with the retirement of Jon Jones . the only change in the latest divisional rankings is one weight class down at light heavyweight, where Khalil Rountree Jr. moves into the top 5 on the strength of his dominating win over former champion jamahal Hill .
